com.xjeffrose.xio.handler.util

Class ContextualMessageQueue<C,M>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xjeffrose.xio.handler.util.ContextualMessageQueue<C,M>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - the type for the context for the message
    M - the type of the message being added to the queue

    public class ContextualMessageQueue<C,M>
extends Object
    Queue up contextualMessages until the queue starts streaming, then consume queued contextualMessages and allow all future contextualMessages to pass straight to the consumer.

    Barrier is re-usable and can be reset to support Keep-Alive

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ContextualMessageQueue(java.util.function.BiConsumer<C,M> consumer)
      Registers a consumer with this barrier.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addContextualMessage(C ctx, M msg)
      Will either queue up a message or provide it to the consumer depending on if we are in streaming mode or not.
      void forEach(java.util.function.BiConsumer<C,M> consumer)
      Allows a consumer to consume the stream of queued up contextualMessages.
      void forEachMessage(java.util.function.Consumer<M> consumer)
      Allows a consumer to consume the stream of queued up messages without their context.
      boolean isStreaming()
      Check if the queue is in streaming mode.
      void reset()
      Clears all contextualMessages and resets to non-streaming mode.
      int size()
      Returns the number of queued contextualMessages.
      void startStreaming()
      Initiates streaming mode and streams all queued up contextualMessages to the registered consumer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContextualMessageQueue

        public ContextualMessageQueue(java.util.function.BiConsumer<C,M> consumer)
        Registers a consumer with this barrier. The consumer will not receive any contextualMessages until the queue begins streaming.
        Parameters:
        consumer - a BiConsumer that will be fed each context and message pair once streaming starts.

    • Method Detail

      • addContextualMessage

        public boolean addContextualMessage(C ctx,
                                    M msg)
        Will either queue up a message or provide it to the consumer depending on if we are in streaming mode or not.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context for the message being added
        msg - the message being added to the queue
        Returns:
        boolean true if provided to consumer

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears all contextualMessages and resets to non-streaming mode.

      • forEach

        public void forEach(java.util.function.BiConsumer<C,M> consumer)
        Allows a consumer to consume the stream of queued up contextualMessages. Using forEach will not clear or reset the queue.
        Parameters:
        consumer - a BiConsumer that will be fed each context and message pair.

      • forEachMessage

        public void forEachMessage(java.util.function.Consumer<M> consumer)
        Allows a consumer to consume the stream of queued up messages without their context.
        Parameters:
        consumer - a Consumer that will be fed each message.

      • startStreaming

        public void startStreaming()
        Initiates streaming mode and streams all queued up contextualMessages to the registered consumer.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of queued contextualMessages. Once streaming begins the queue should remain empty.
        Returns:
        the number of queued contextualMessages.

      • isStreaming

        public boolean isStreaming()
        Check if the queue is in streaming mode.
        Returns:
        true if contextualMessages are being streamed to the consumer
